messages.subject: Conferences based on this discussion
messages.msgSnippet: Always Learning Live events have been held now in New Mexico and Massachusetts.   Next weekend (starting this Thursday) a couple of dozen families are meeting
messages.messageBody:
Always Learning Live events have been held now in New Mexico and Massachusetts. Next weekend (starting this Thursday) a couple of dozen families are meeting in Minneapolis at a water park: http://allunschoolingminnesota2013.blogspot.com

It's too late to get discount rooms, but the rooms aren't very much anyway and they come with four waterpark passes. Speakers are Jill Parmer, Alex Polikowsky and me, and there will be guided discussions based on a model I used for years in philosophy discussions within the SCA. I haven't done these at conferences before, but Rippy Dusseldorp and I talked about it last summer, and I've been thinking about it.

This summer, Joyce Fetteroll and I will speak in four places. Three are Always Learning events, and one is the LiTTLe Conference, run by Julie Daniel near London. Lisbon, London, Leiden (and Selkirk) is what I've been calling the little circuit, although the order is this:
Lisbon, Portugal June 1-2, 2013
Selkirk (Scotland) UK June 24 (a Monday)
Leiden, the Netherlands, June 29
Ashford, Surrey, UK July 13-14
http://speakingsandradodd.blogspot.com/p/europe-2013.html

In December I'll do another event here in Albuquerque between Christmas and New Year's but I don't have a site up for it yet.

In 2014 there is a possibility and some definites:

Joyce and Sandra to Australia in March and early April for five gatherings, the last one of which will include Schuyler Waynforth and her husband, David.
http://speakingsandradodd.blogspot.com/p/australia-2014.html

Maybe California (still talking)

Late September, Maine and New Hampshire (still being sorted out, but a definite plan):
http://speakingsandradodd.blogspot.com/p/maine-septemberoctober-2014.html

Those interested in Minneapolis should do something soon. :-)

Those interested in the others can put it on the calendar and start saving money! :-)

Sandra
